dfischer.utils

Interface RunJUnitMethodInterface


  • public interface RunJUnitMethodInterface
    Support to run JUnit test methods in parallel threads.
    See Also:
    RunJUnitMethodThread

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean runJUnitMethod(java.lang.String testMethodName, LoadtestPluginContext pluginContext)
      Run a JUnit test method.
      Note: All variables used in this method must be local (related to this method) in order to support parallel multithreading.

    • Method Detail

      • runJUnitMethod

        boolean runJUnitMethod(java.lang.String testMethodName,
                     LoadtestPluginContext pluginContext)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Run a JUnit test method.
        Note: All variables used in this method must be local (related to this method) in order to support parallel multithreading. This method can be executed in parallel at the same time by multiple treads - but all of the treads are using the same common instance of the load test plug-in. You can proof that by adding the static modifier to the method - if the compilation is successful then it will work. After that you must remove the static modifier and compile the class once again.
        Parameters:
        testMethodName - the name of the JUnit test method
        pluginContext - the plug-in context
        Returns:
        true if the run was successful. Note: Normally this method should never throw an exception. If an exception is thrown this means that an internal error has occurred, and that the whole load test will be immediately aborted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
